headline.main: Should Social Security Taxes Affect All Wages?

headline.main: Misconceptions Could Lead to Health Law 'Train Wreck,' Baucus Warns

docs.lead_paragraph: Since insurers pay more for patients with surgical complications, some hospitals could actually lose money by improving care, researchers said Tuesday.

headline.seo: Hospitals Profit From Surgical Errors, Study Finds
headline.main: Hospitals Profit From Surgical Errors, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Hospitals Profit From Surgical Mistakes, Study Finds

docs.abstract: Study published in Journal of American Medical Assn finds that hospitals profit from their own mistakes because insurers pay them for longer stays and extra care that patients need to treat surgical complications that could have been prevented; results mean some hospitals could actually lose money by improving care.
docs.snippet: Since insurers pay more for patients with surgical complications, some hospitals could actually lose money by improving care, researchers said Tuesday.

headline.main: Why Do I Think My Salary Pays for Child Care?

docs.abstract: Both working parents are equally in need of child care. So why do I suddenly think of my salary as paying that bill?
docs.snippet: Both working parents are equally in need of child care. So why do I suddenly think of my salary as paying that bill?

docs.lead_paragraph: Something seems wrong when more than 90 percent of Japanese are said to have health problems.
docs.snippet: Something seems wrong when more than 90 percent of Japanese are said to have health problems.

docs.lead_paragraph:
On a recent Sunday afternoon, a 75-year-old Philadelphia man with a fever of over 102 degrees was unable to reach his doctor. So his daughter took him to an emergency room, where the two sat for hours until he was examined by a physician who found no reason for the fever and decided to admit him overnight.
 
The man was given oxygen, a chest X-ray , a blood test and, finally, a urine test, which revealed a urinary tract infection . The problem was solved with a prescription for an antibiotic , but at a cost of thousands of dollars to Medicare .
